Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Esketamine for PONV Prophylaxis in Gynecological Laparoscopy

Trial_Design.evidence: In this single-center, double-blind trial, 150 patients aged 18–60 years, ASA I–II, undergoing elective GLS at the Third Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University were randomized

Participants.evidence: 150 patients aged 18–60 years, ASA I–II, undergoing elective GLS at the Third Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive esketamine (0.25mg/kg, n=75) or sufentanil (0.1μg/kg, n=75)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates esketamine, an NMDA receptor antagonist, for PONV prophylaxis compared to sufentanil.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was PONV incidence and severity within 48 hours postoperation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed in opaque envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: double-blind trial... Outcome assessors and data collectors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 150 patients... The study was conducted from April 2023 to July 2024.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The esketamine group showed significantly lower PONV incidence in the PACU (57.3% vs 36%, p=0.014) and at 24 hours (53.3% vs 36%, p=0.048).

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported.
